claim: England’s players have the heaviest average weights among all countries in the dataset.
extra_info: heaviest average weights refers to MAX(AVG(weight))
reasoning: The data shows that Germany's players have the highest average weight (approximately 173.35), not England's players (approximately 170.75). England ranks second among all countries in the dataset.

content.text: The connection between players and countries is through Match (which has country_id and player columns). Let me check which countries exist and then compute average weight per country by linking players to the country of the matches they played in.
Now let me compute the average weight of players per country. I'll collect all distinct players per country (from home and away lineups) and compute their average weight.

input.command:
sqlite3 "/Users/david/workspace/claimdb/test_dbs/european_football_2.sqlite" "
WITH country_players AS (
    SELECT DISTINCT c.name AS country_name, p.player_api_id, p.weight
    FROM Match m
    JOIN Country c ON m.country_id = c.id
    JOIN Player p ON p.player_api_id IN (
        m.home_player_1, m.home_player_2, m.home_player_3, m.home_player_4,
        m.home_player_5, m.home_player_6, m.home_player_7, m.home_player_8,
        m.home_player_9, m.home_player_10, m.home_player_11,
        m.away_player_1, m.away_player_2, m.away_player_3, m.away_player_4,
        m.away_player_5, m.away_player_6, m.away_player_7, m.away_player_8,
        m.away_player_9, m.away_player_10, m.away_player_11
    )
    WHERE p.weight IS NOT NULL
)
SELECT country_name, AVG(weight) AS avg_weight
FROM country_players
GROUP BY country_name
ORDER BY avg_weight DESC;
"
input.description: Compute average player weight per country

content.text:
The results are clear. Germany has the highest average weight (173.35), followed by England (170.75). England does NOT have the heaviest average weight — Germany does.
